titlestmt.titleproper:
Guide to the Dorothy Warren papers
circa 1889-1969
MS 3177
titlestmt.author: Elise Winks

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2021-04-12 14:17:08 -0400.

physdesc.extent: in 3 cartons and 5 oversize flat boxes

did.abstract: Dorothy Warren's personal papers including Christmas cards, newspaper clippings, correspondence, reports, committee notes, museum programs, and pamphlets. Also published items including magazines, reports, pamphlets on mid-20th century topics such as space exploration, John F.Kennedy's assassination, the House Un-American Activities Committee, and politics.
did.langmaterial: The documents in the collection are in English.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p:
Photocopying undertaken by staff only. Limited to 20 exposures of stable, unbound material per day.
Application to use images from this collection for publication should be made in writing to: Department of Rights and Reproductions, The New-York Historical Society, 170 Central Park West, New York, NY 10024-5194, rightsandrepro@nyhistory.org. Phone: (212) 873-3400 ext. 282.

Copyrights and other proprietary rights may subsist in individuals and entities other than the New-York Historical Society, in which case the patron is responsible for securing permission from those parties. For fuller information about rights and reproductions from N-YHS visit: https://www.nyhistory.org/about/rights-reproductions

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: The collection should be cited as: Dorothy Warren papers, MS 3177, New-York Historical Society.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: The collection is not processed. As part of a project conducted in 2019-20, archivist Elise Winks performed a high level survey of the collection and described it broadly in this preliminary finding aid.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Published items: magazines, reports, pamphlets on midcentury topics: space exploration, JFK assassination, HUAC, politics. Archival materials: Christmas cards, clippings, correspondence, reports, committee notes and other papers, museum programs and pamphlets on -Cooper Union/Hewitt - Turtle Bay Music School -New York House and School of Industry -Embroiderer's Guild -Old Merchant's House -Black Manifesto -7th Regiment -Cutler School
